servinfo.title: DTC P2227 / P2228 / P2229: Barometric Pressure Circuit Malfunction
servinfo.subtitle: DTC P2227: Barometric Pressure Circuit Range / Performance
DTC P2228: Barometric Pressure Circuit Low
DTC P2229: Barometric Pressure Circuit High

servinfosub.title: System Description
servinfosub.ptxt: Barometric pressure sensor is installed in ECM.

servinfosub.title: DTC Detecting Condition and Trouble Area

entry.ptxt: Difference of barometric pressure value and intake manifold pressure value is higher than specified value while engine cranking.

item.ptxt: Manifold absolute pressure sensor performance problem

entry.ptxt: Barometric pressure signal less than specified value is detected.
Barometric pressure signal more than specified value is detected.

item.ptxt: When performing a road test, select a place where there is no traffic or possibility of a traffic accident and be very careful during testing to avoid occurrence of an accident.
Road test should be carried out by 2 persons, a driver and a tester, on a level road.

s1.ptxt: Connect scan tool to DLC with ignition switch turned OFF.
Turn ON ignition switch and clear DTC, pending DTC and freeze frame data by using scan tool and warm up engine to normal operating temperature.
Check DTC and pending DTC by using scan tool.
Connect scan tool to DLC with ignition switch turned OFF.
Turn ON ignition switch, clear DTC by using scan tool and run engine for 1 min.
Check DTC and pending DTC by using scan tool.

attention3.ptxt: Before this trouble shooting is performed, read the precautions for DTC troubleshooting referring to Precautions For DTC Troubleshooting .

testgroup.question: Was “Engine and Emission Control System Check” performed?

action.ptxt: Go to Engine and Emission Control System Check .
Substitute a known-good ECM and recheck.

test1.ptxt: Check MAP sensor and its circuit referring to DTC P0107: Manifold Absolute Pressure Circuit Low Input and/or DTC P0108: Manifold Absolute Pressure Circuit High Input .

action.ptxt: Substitute a known-good ECM and recheck.
MAP sensor or its circuit malfunction.
